definition: reckless/regardless of everything
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to cut/to slice/tangent (math)
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: You're mad because he lied to you.
sentences.chinese: 你因为他对你撒了个谎就气得不顾一切了。

sentences.english: Their slums are filled with desperatelypoor people who have fled worse poverty in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 那里的贫民区住满了不顾一切逃离最贫穷乡村的穷人。

sentences.english: Isn't it amazing how desperate the Chinese are for positive publicity?
sentences.chinese: 中国人为了获得好名声不顾一切，难道不吃惊吗？
你会不顾一切地花费更多。

sentences.english: You will only realize His voice more clearly by recklessness.
sentences.chinese: 只有当你不顾一切时，才更清楚认出他的声音。

sentences.english: They will do everything they can before that happens to them.
sentences.chinese: 他们会不顾一切来阻止这种情况的出现。

sentences.english: At times I'd like to break through and hold you endlessly.
sentences.chinese: 有时又想不顾一切来紧紧抱住你。

sentences.english: Desperate, the shepherd began tugging them to the other side.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人不顾一切的拉着它们朝另一边走去。

sentences.english: I won't forget all the encouragment I got from my team members.
sentences.chinese: 不会忘记不顾一切喊破喉咙为队员加油的同学。

sentences.english: He stood fast at his post despite all difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他不顾一切困难坚守岗位。

sentences.english: I often feel reckless and out of control when I shop.
sentences.chinese: 在我购物的时候，我经常有不顾一切和失控的感觉。

sentences.english: The Chinese government is desperately trying to put thebrakes on the economy.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府正不顾一切地设法让经济减速。

sentences.english: Yong-shou Chen in Li Zhixun desperate rescue finally turned the corner.
sentences.chinese: 陈永寿在李致勋不顾一切的抢救下终于转危为安。

sentences.english: On Tuesday, the women were desperate to see their home, but fearful.
sentences.chinese: 周二，她们不顾一切的回到她们的家，却又充满恐惧。

sentences.english: It's the bowling ball, and Earth is the pin.
sentences.chinese: 正是它要不顾一切地撞向地球。

sentences.english: One is the defiant reaffirmation of dogma .
sentences.chinese: 一个是对教条不顾一切地重新肯定。

definition: to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
without the slightest hesitation
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
doom/death/desperately
crazy/mad/madly
hysteria (loanword)/hysterical
to stake all on one throw
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
not stint/not spare/not hesitate (to do sth)/not scruple (to do sth)
in spite of/regardless of
to lose one's life/to die/recklessly/desperately
without the slightest hesitation
